results.title: Caught in the net
results.creator_credit: David Tennant, Lori Roth, Nathan Neumer, National Film Board of Canada and Still Water Pictures
results.brief_description: A thought provoking short documentary about exercising caution when developing friendships over the Internet and for the level of information that is disclosed. It does this through a discussion between two friends who have met and become friends in real life. This is compared to the relationship that is developing between one of them and someone he has ‘met’ over the Internet in a discussion room and via email. It questions issues such as what information is volunteered, what is held back, intuition, and whose on the other end of this unknown and faceless form of communication.

results.title: Cattle ranch
results.creator_credit: Guy L. Cote, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The life of the cowboy, filmed through the seasons on Canada’s biggest cattle ranch near Kanloops, British Colombia. With musical accompaniment by American folk singer Peter Seeger and narration by Frances Hyland, ‘Cattle Ranch’ presents a vividly dramatic picture of the open range where a cowboy is king, where calves are born, live with the herd for a time in the splendour of mountain meadows, then join the trek to the city abattoir. Awards: Locarno; Rome; Vancouver; Montreal
results.creator_credit_for_label: Guy L. Cote, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Cast away [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Robert Zemeckis, Jack Rapke, Steve Starkey, Tom Hanks, NBCUniversal and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Tom Hanks stars as Chuck Noland, a FedEx systems engineer whose workaholic tendencies doesn’t leave him much time for his family or long suffering girlfriend (Helen Hunt). When a horrific plane crash (executed with ferocious intensity by director Robert Zemeckis) leaves him stranded on a deserted island, the time obsessed Noland must now learn how to live at a different pace. Zemeckis and Hanks (who conceived the original idea) carefully map out the daily toils Noland must now face, from how to get food and water, to the growing sense of isolation the solitary Noland struggles with. Screen writer William Broyles Jnr’s solution to his loneliness is to create an unlikely man Friday, a volleyball washed ashore and christened Wilson by the grateful cast away. Zemeckis wisely chooses to play out the island sequences in virtual silence, doing away with most of the film score and Hanks dialogue. “Cast Away” inevitably becomes a familiar triumph of the human spirit tale, however it’s FedEx that ultimately triumphs, receiving one of the more generous product-placements in recent film memory. Cast includes Nick Searcy and Chris Noth.

results.title: Casey
results.creator_credit: Neil Munro, Tom Haydon and ABC
results.brief_description: This film is a view of the life and career of the former Governor-General of Australia, Lord Casey. It is the first film about Lord Casey and covers the span of years from his birth in Brisbane in 1890 to his installation as a Knight of Garter at Windsor Castle nearly eighty years later. Following on from his political career which included such appointments as Treasurer in the Lyons government, Minister of Supply and Development in the first Menzies government, six years of World War II as the first Australian Minister to the United States and eventually Minister for External Affairs, Lord Casey finally became Governor-General of Australia in 1966. Photographers: Les Wesley, John Atkinson, Ron Bollman, David Brill.

results.title: Catholic boys
results.creator_credit: Michael Dinner, Dan Wigutow, Mark Carliner and Silver Screen Partners
results.brief_description: Set in Brooklyn in 1965, this comedy film focuses on several Catholic school boys who get into ever increasing amounts of trouble with the presiding priests of the Catholic school, St. Basil’s. Michael is the new student who latches onto the class egghead, Caesar, who is constantly picked on by the class bully, Rooney. Rooney intimidates Michael and Caesar into becoming his erstwhile chums and, along with a few other members of the ‘gang’, they receive corporal punishment for minor infractions, disrupting communion and confession and, ultimately, their antics inspire changes in the strict school hierarchy. Cast includes: Andrew McCarthy, Mary Stuart Masterson, Kevin Dillon, Malcom Danare, Donald Sutherland, John Heard and Patrick Dempsey.

results.title: Catherine the Great: a profile in power
results.creator_credit: Arthur Voronka, Learning Corporation of America and Look Hear Productions
results.brief_description: Explores, through use of an imaginary historical interview, the life and the role of Catherine the Great of Russia. Cast includes Zoe Caldwell and Patrick Watson. Written by Patrick Withrow. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Carve her name with pride
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Daniel M. Angel and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Based on R.J. Minney’s novel this inspiring true story of war heroine, Violette Szabo, who volunteered to be parachuted into France as a secret agent to re-organise a shattered resistance group. Virginia McKenna gives the performance of her career as the courageous secret agent, and this magnificent film ensures that no-one will forget Violette’s bravery and conviction in what she believed in most - freedom from tyranny. Also stars Paul Scofield, Jack Warner, Denise Grey and Maurice Ronet.

results.title: Catch the Wind
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia and University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department
results.brief_description: Catch the Wind is a guide to dinghy sailing designed for instructors, schools, sail-training institutes and beginners. It is designed to provide a thorough and entertaining introduction to the basics of sailing.

results.title: Catch 'em being good (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ron Friedman, Marlene Schneider and Synergetic Productions
results.brief_description: Instructional film for teachers demonstrating various approaches to motivating and disciplining students in the classroom. Shows methods for teachers to get the best out of their students, particularly the more difficult ones.

results.title: Castro's Cuba
results.creator_credit: Chris Sheridan, Keith Lambourne and Independent Television News (GB)
results.brief_description: Cuba has been embargoed by the USA, abandoned by Russia, is one of the remaining issues of the Cold War and is close to bankruptcy, but the citizens of the country still fervently support their leader Fidel Castro. This documentary tells the story of Castro’s rise to power, the revolution of 1959, his reform programmes and his program of relations with the world’s superpowers as well as regional neighbours. It also investigates why this charismatic man is so adored by his citizens and how he has maintained his ‘beloved’ status for so long.
